reviewText: I enjoyed this starter light weight lifting tape. It is not a fancy DVD, but does the job. I liked the relaxing pictures at the end of the tape.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am 57, quite overweight and completely out of shape, and a total sedentary person (spend most of time sitting and studying), but I found this workout to be perfect for me.  This workout pushes you just a little bit past the comfort zone, and I started to feel much stronger and better after just 2 workouts.There was another reviewer who said it is not a beginner's workout because of the crunches, etc., but as with all workouts, you just do what you can do.  I am quite overweight, so I cannot do the crunch very well at all where you cross the elbow over to the opposite knee, but so what?  I know I will improve over time, which is the whole point.  I also could not even get close to doing the deep lunges, so I modified it and did just very slight lunges.  I still would call this a beginner's workout because everything was doable for me, I lasted to the end, and "Sunshine" never makes you go impossibly long with any one exercise.THIS DVD IS THE EXACT SAME ONE AS THE BOOMER'S WORKOUT - hope amazon.com accepts the return because of course it is opened.To Ariana (who replies to the comments), if you are affiliated with this company, please put in the description on amazon that these DVDs are identical.  It is easy enough to return a DVD, but an unnecessary use of time and money that could have been avoided.
summary: Great beginner's workout, but BEWARE - THIS IS THE SAME DVD AS THE BOOMER'S WORKOUT
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like this DVD.  I started out using three-pound weights and I notice when I go up to five-pound weights, I get really sore, so it must be good exercise!  My only nitpick is that the DVD is a bit amateurish.  For instance, some of the words that appear on the screen are misspelled.  Nice introduction to weight training, though, in a pretty beach setting.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another reviewer said they could do all of the exercises easily the first time--they must have been younger or more fit than I am. I can only do the exercises with two pound weights (3 to 5 pounds is recommended). Some of her segues are a little fast--I'm still getting up from the floor when she's on her feet doing the next exercise. The time does go fast though and the actual exercises are done at a medium to slow rate. I love the relaxation part at the end. I'd buy another one of her dvd's.
Title: N/A

reviewText: At first look this dvd seems sorta cheesy but who cares if you do it!! I have been able to keep up using this dvd. I have found with some dvds I spent too much time visualizing what I am supposed to be doing instead of doing. What I like about this one is that it is in voice over. The person doing the exercises may or may not be the one describing and counting but I don't get distracted. I am a 51 year old woman that has just started trying to get back to feeling healthy again and this dvd is one I would recommend to people in that position.The exercises are all doable for me well the lunges are still giving me fits but I don't feel like I am outta my league at all. And I do feel the results too.
summary: Exercise dvds only work  if you use them and this one I do
Title: N/A
